captions.text:
Today we are going to be looking at some of
the Top 5 Video Game WTF's. There are way

more than 5 out there, but, guess what, 5
is a nice round number, and, it's the number
of girlfriends I have. And by 5, I mean 0.

Definitions: I'm not including things that
are obvious and intended. And I'm not including

things that are fan-made, but I really wish
I could. And I'm also not including things
that are part of winning the game.

Number 5 is a CoDMW2WTF, and, yeah, it's a
blow up. But not that kind...this kind.

In Assassin's Creed, MPC's have been found
glitched out, humping the walls at amazing

speeds. I would be a lot more weirded out
if I wasn't so impressed with their speed.
Look at that. I want that.

World of Warcraft is filled with WTF's. We
could make an entire countdown just about

them, but let me show you my favorite. In
Dalaran there's a Blood Elf who continuously

strokes a red-hot metal rod. Let's just take
a moment of silence.

If you jump on your Rhino and your barrel
at the same time, you ride the Rhino. Ride.
Number 1:

I love this because of its subtlety. It's
in Bioshock. After what appears to be a big

explosion, take a look...yeah...that is why
this is number 1.

So, there you go. To me, those are some of
the Top 5 WTF's in video gaming, but there

are so many more. If you had already seen
every clip I talked about today, give this

video a thumbs up to let everyone know that
you are a genius, and if you've seen others

that aren't on this list, please put it in
the comments. I want to see more of these
things, they're are awesome.

Once you've done that, be sure to subscribe,
and stay Saucy my friends.

(In whisper) Psst, hey, hey are you still
there? Ok, awesome, listen to me. There's

this really cool thing I found- it's called
Facebook. I don't know, it's kind of weird,

I don't really get it. But, we're there, check
it out. There's a link in the description.
Ok, ok, bye.

comments.text:
Because originally it was written down like so , UU Only connected in the 
middle, we pronounce it as Double-Yew/you, (Yew/You being this character 
here U)  Simply named because it was 2 U's connected via the central point, 
Now you have learnt something. http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/W

words with the same pronunciation.  Idk that's just what I have heard.
comments.author: Jamie Lee

comments.text:
+KasaresStern You are such a hypocrite. Telling me I can't say something is 
proven without the source? Where is your source that says it isn't? Anyway, 
I meant to say one of the hardest so sorry about that. Here's some links 
that are debating about it.
http://www.debate.org/opinions/is-english-the-most-difficult-language-to-learn
http://www.answers.com/Q/What_is_the_hardest_language_to_learn
http://www.antimoon.com/forum/t5260-30.htm
Although the difficulty of a language depends on what is your first 
language and how similar it is to other languages such as English/Spanish. 
Now I really don't want to continue this argument for very long since i'm 
already having an argument with a guy about religion. But lets just agree 
that it is ONE of the hardest languages in the world.
comments.author: Kaleb Lux

comments.text:

an idea of why i have this opinion about Polish.
comments.author: KasaresStern

comments.text: +KasaresStern does polish have 5 genders?
comments.author: Fabulous Killjoy (Yeah)

comments.text:
+Rutger Traa i've met many Polish people, and they don't find it difficult, 
but the reason is pretty simple: Any language isn't hard for its native 
speakers, since it's part of their educational process and their own 
raising (You comprehend the world thanks to your language, but you are not 
entirely aware of the process). Unless you have educational difficulties, 
you won't even notice if it was difficult or not to learn your native 
language.

Some languages prepare you for learning other ones (for example, polish is 
easier for any slavic root language speaker, while spanish will be easier 
for other latin-rooted language speakers), that's why as you get 
profficient with more languages, it will get also easier to learn new ones. 
But a language with 5 genders, 17 ways to say the number "2", 8 
conjugations... Is pretty much the nightmare of any phylologist
comments.author: KasaresStern

comments.text: +KasaresStern I know someone who is polish. It isn't that hard isn't it?
comments.author: Fabulous Killjoy (Yeah)

comments.text:
+Kaleb Lux "It's proved"? What is there to prove about? English is 
objectively not the hardest language out there, in fact it's accounted as 
one of the easiest. You can't go saying "it's proven" and not goving the 
source of that information.

Objectively speaking, the hardest language to learn is Polish, even harder 
than Mandarin (The most popular dialect of Chinese) or even Latin. In a 
scale of difficulty taking as objective ways of measure the number of 
genders, number of conjugations for verbs, grammar laws and exceptions, 
while English would be a 2 and Spanish would be a 3 or a 4 depending of the 
lexical extension we are speaking (As it IS the language with the biggest 
number of words), Japanese would be a 5 and Mandarin would be a 6... But 
polish in this scale is an 8! I got introduced to this way of valorating a 
language's difficulty by a translation teacher in Granada, and he gave 
sound reasons about why Polish is difficult as hell.
comments.author: KasaresStern

comments.text: +Rutger Traa Chinese is pretty easy.
